kill_everyone_strategy.core_philosophy: Optimal tournament strategy using mathematical approach based on CSI and Nash equilibrium solutions
key_concepts: CSI (Chip Stacks Index) determines optimal strategy
Push/fold becomes optimal when stacks get short
Position and stack sizes more important than hand strength alone

csi_0_to_2.primary_strategy: Push or fold only - no other actions
key_points: Push any two cards from small blind vs big blind
Push very wide from button in heads-up
Look for any spot to get chips in the middle
Survival mode - need to double up quickly
common_mistakes: Folding in small blind when should push any two

csi_2_to_7.primary_strategy: Primarily push/fold with specific hand ranges
key_points: Use detailed push/fold charts for each position
Slightly tighter ranges than CSI 0-2
Can occasionally flat call with premium hands
Still avoid marginal post-flop situations
adjustments: Consider stack sizes of opponents behind

csi_7_to_12.primary_strategy: Mixed strategy - push/fold and limited post-flop
key_points: Can start playing some post-flop poker
Still primarily push/fold in many spots
Use position more aggressively
Can call raises with strong hands occasionally
post_flop_guidelines: Avoid marginal spots without good odds

key_points: Can use full range of poker skills
Still consider CSI for major decisions
Use position and post-flop play more
Can play speculative hands in position

early_position.opening_ranges: Premium hands only - AA-99, AK, AQ

csi_adjustments.medium_stack: Can limp with small pairs occasionally

middle_position.opening_ranges: Slightly wider - add KQ, AJ, smaller pairs

button_strategy: Very wide pushing ranges when short
Can play many speculative hands when deep
cutoff_strategy: Good spot for 3-bet bluffs when deep

small_blind: Complete with wide range when folded to
Defend with proper odds against raises
Push very wide when short stacked
big_blind: Get good pot odds to call raises
Can call wider against late position raises
Push over limpers when stack is short

adjustments: They will fold too often to aggression
Don't get into raising wars without premium hands

key_points: Deep stacks allow post-flop play
Avoid marginal spots
Look for good spots to double up
Don't risk tournament life without good reason
Antes make stealing more profitable
Stack sizes become more critical
Start using CSI-based strategy more
Look for accumulation spots
Many players tighten up near money
Can steal more frequently
Be selective about big confrontations
ICM considerations become important
Players may tighten for next pay jump
Can be more aggressive against medium stacks
Short stacks become very desperate
Final table dynamics change everything

strategic_errors: Not adjusting strategy based on CSI
Playing too many marginal hands early position
Calling instead of pushing with short stacks
Not being aggressive enough on the bubble
mathematical_errors: Ignoring implied odds with drawing hands

key_formulas.csi_calculation: CSI = Total Chips / (Small Blind + Big Blind + Antes per hand)
key_formulas.pot_odds: Odds = (Pot Size + Opponent Bet) / Amount to Call
key_formulas.implied_odds: Consider future betting when drawing to strong hands
key_formulas.chip_ev: In tournaments, consider ICM not just chip accumulation
